videos.description: Helps with balance and grounding through the feet. Stand tall with big toes touching and heels together.
videos.subtitle: Yoga exercises
videos.title: Mountain Pose

videos.description: Excellent for leg and abdominal strength. Good for seniors to do for balance and concentration. Itâ€™s ok for the leg to be lower on the inner standing leg. I tell my seniors to start with Baby Tree or use a chair for support.
videos.subtitle: Yoga exercises
videos.title: Tree Pose

videos.description: Start kneeling, and stretch one arm forward and the opposite leg back. Imagine you have a tea cup on your back and draw your belly button towards your spine. Stay for a breath, then switch sides.
videos.subtitle: Yoga exercises
videos.title: Bird Dog

videos.description: Lie down on your stomach and place your forearms on the mat, elbows under your shoulders. Press firmly into the arms and draw your shoulder blades together and down your back. Lift your abdominals in and up and stay for five to eight breaths.
videos.subtitle: Yoga exercises
videos.title: Sphinx

videos.description: Fold forward for a deeper stretch but try to prevent rounding too much in the lower back. Hold for five to eight breaths.
videos.subtitle: Yoga exercises
videos.title: Cobblers pose
